intro: Ichnanthus indutus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that are typically covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Ichnanthus indutus is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
